results.title: The Snowy Mountain Scheme: the first achievement
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Reports on the initial preparations and planning in the Snowy Mountains region and the completion of the first project of the scheme - the Guthega project. Construction of the Guthega Dam and Munyang power station was begun and despite the difficulty of a cold climate, the project was completed and the power house officially opened by the Prime Minister, Mr Menzies, on 23 April 1955.

results.title: The Snowy day
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Mal Wittman and Morton Schindel
results.brief_description: The silent wonder of city snow and Peter’s delight in it as he slides down snow mountains and takes a snowball home in his pocket are told in exquisite collages that reflect the sparkling quality of snow and the contrasting warmth of the home and family. Narrated by Jane Harvey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Weston Woods Studios, Mal Wittman and Morton Schindel

results.title: The Snowy day
results.brief_description: 4 year old Peter wakes one morning to discover the city he lives in covered in a blanket of fresh, white snow. Outside, he sees a wonderland of snowmen, snow angels and snowballs. Before going inside to get warm, he makes a snowball and puts it in his pocket for safe keeping. Before going to bed that night he checks his pockets and discovers that it has melted. That night he dreams that all the snow has melted away, only to wake up and find fresh snow falling. Based on the book by Ezra Jack Keats and narrated by Jane Harvey. Winner of the Caldecott Medal in 1976 for the most distinguished picture book for children.

results.title: The Snowy : A Dream of Growing Up
results.creator_credit: Siobhan McHugh, Film Australia and Stephen Ramsey
results.brief_description: Australia’s Snowy Mountains Scheme is one of the world’s greatest engineering feats. The project to bring water to the dry west was built between 1949 and 1974, employing 100,000 people, many of them migrants who brought with them changes that have shaped Australia. This film documents Australia’s ambitious project using interviews and historical film. Based on the book “The Snowy : the People Behind the Power” by Siobhan McHugh.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Siobhan McHugh, Film Australia and Stephen Ramsey

results.title: The Snows of Kilimanjaro
results.creator_credit: Darryl F. Zanuck, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Henry King
results.brief_description: A hunter lies wounded in Africa and while waiting for help looks back over his life and loves. Hollywood version of a portable Hemingway, with reminiscences of several novels stirred into a lush and sprawling mix of action and romance, open spaces and smart salons. A big popular star film of its time. Starring Gregory Peck, Susan Hayward and Ava Gardner.

results.title: The Snowman (K)
results.creator_credit: John Coates, Snowman Enterprises and Dianne Jackson
results.brief_description: A young boy dreams that his snowman comes to life. Together they share the perils and joys of winter. This animated film uses muted pastels coupled with an exquisite orchestral score to make this non-verbal Christmas tale an experience for all seasons. Based on the book by Raymond Briggs.

results.title: The Snow queen
results.creator_credit: Vladlen Barbe, Mark Buchwald, Igor Kostigin, Joshua M. Greene, Lightyear Entertainment and Klassika Studio Moscow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories to remember”.
Sigourney Weaver narrates Andersen’s moving story of a young girl’s quest for her young friend who has been captured by the beautiful but heartless Snow Queen and taken to her icy palace far from humankind. Along the way she makes new friends who help her in her search. Based on Susan Jeffers’ illustrations for the picture book adaptation by Amy Ehrlich.

results.title: The Snow queen
results.brief_description: Gerda, a little girl who sets out on an amazing journey to find her friend Kay, who has fallen under the evil spell of the Snow Queen. On her journey she has to contend with the Summer garden witch, the robbers in the wood, and the Snow Queen herself. Only Gerda, helped by birds and animals, has the power to overcome them all.
